bug.author: jiyer2016
bug.summary: autogenerated requirements.txt is missing version numbers of select dependencies
bug.description:
Describe the bug I use the auto_pip_dependencies on the env_decorator for my Service @bentoml.env(auto_pip_dependencies=True) After I save the Service - as expected the BentoML autogenerates a requirements.txt with the correct list of dependent packages. However I notice that the version number of scikit-learn is left unspecified. Why is this the case ? The versions of the other two libraries match that of the training environment. Shouldn't I expect the same of scikit-learn as well ? ** Contents of autogenerated requirements.txt** <denchmark-code>scikit-learn bentoml==0.8.4 numpy==1.19.1 </denchmark-code>
Environment: <denchmark-code> - OS: Windows 10 - Python 3.8.3 - bentoml, version 0.8.4
</denchmark-code>

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jiyer2016>@jiyer2016</denchmark-link> thanks for reporting this! Here's the existing feature request ticket tracking this issue: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bentoml/BentoML/issues/695>#695</denchmark-link> - this is a top priority for us. When artifact class is adding the pip dependency(<denchmark-link:https://github.com/bentoml/BentoML/blob/v0.8.5/bentoml/artifact/sklearn_model_artifact.py#L107>here</denchmark-link> for example), it should grab the current version number from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bentoml/BentoML/blob/v0.8.5/bentoml/saved_bundle/pip_pkg.py#L52>here</denchmark-link> and save it to the generated requirements.txt file.
This is fixed in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bentoml/BentoML/pull/1086>#1086</denchmark-link> , will be available in next release 0.9.0
